stories.text:
I'm currently switching from a career in devops consulting to launching a startup that relies heavily on data engineering. The first book I've picked up to sharpen my skills is 'The Pragmatic Programmer' by Andy Hunt and Dave Thomas, as it seems to be the most recommended book in HN threads.

One of the recommendations in the book is to learn a new language every year, and read a technical book every month. I'd love to know what technical books you've read and why they are great.
stories.title: Ask HN: What excellent technical books have you read in 2021?
